It is neither A nor B.  The question is how the very first 
generation coul=
d proceed when there is no information about either 
population to begin wi=
th.  Our paper may have omitted this detail.

We used a tournament in one p=
opulation (say A) to bootstrap the 
process.  It was basically like a sport=
s championship tournament, 
where everyone is paired off, and then those wh=
o won the first round 
play against each other, those who won the second ro=
und play against 
each other, and so on, until the final is between two cha=
mps.  That 
is one reason we used populations of 256 (it is a power of 2). =
 

Note that this tournament gives you a rough idea of who is good and 
who=
 is not in the initial population, which is all you need to get 
the proces=
s rolling.  Then fitnesses are assigned to population A 
based on how well =
individuals did in the tournament and coevolution 
proceeds normally from t=
here.

ken
